comments.body:
How about
```
... will use the short form (typically an abbreviation, for example, day-of-week Monday might output "Mon"). ...
```

BTW we should remove `Exactly 5 pattern letters will use the narrow form`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +64,68 @@The count of pattern letters determines the format.

- Text: The text style is determined based on the number of pattern letters used. Less than 4 pattern letters will use the short form. Exactly 4 pattern letters will use the full form. Exactly 5 pattern letters will use the narrow form. 5 or more letters will fail. More details for the text style:
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
  - Short Form: Short text, typically an abbreviation. For example, day-of-week Monday might output "Mon".

comments.body: not related to this PR, but can we embed this section into `Text: ...`?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +140,144 @@- Symbols of 'Y', 'W', 'w', 'E', 'u', 'F', 'q' and 'Q' can only be used for datetime formatting, e.g. `date_format`. They are not allowed used for datetime parsing, e.g. `to_timestamp`.

More details for the text style:

- Short Form: Short text, typically an abbreviation. For example, day-of-week Monday might output "Mon".

  - `'LLLLL'` or `'MMMMM'`: Narrow textual representation of standard or stand-alone forms. Typically it is a single letter.
